And you almost certainly don’t want to imagine a piece of that junk taking a chunk of your spacecraft’s window with it. Not exactly. http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/speaking-of-science/wp/2016/05/11/did-a-teen-discover-a-lost-mayan-city-not-exactly/ http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/speaking-of-science/wp/2016/05/11/did-a-teen-discover-a-lost-mayan-city-not-exactly/#comments Wed, 11 May 2016 20:11:00 +0000 http://www.washingtonpost.com/news/speaking-of-science/?p=25951 It’s no fun when a feel-good story has to get debunked, especially when it’s a story about a smart, science-loving kid. But, unfortunately, it seems obvious that reports of a Quebec teen “discovering” a lost Maya city have been overblown.
